instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no charging
threads.message:
The board turns on with charger, turns on with the battery charged. But it doesn't charge the battery. I have orange LED.

Very strange situation, the board turns on whenever I connect the battery.

I changed DC and tested with another battery.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.56

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no charging
threads.message:
Its battery works correctly in other machine?

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
The battery port tester from Harald can help you here:
[URL unfurl="true"]http://www.cmizapper.com/products/battery-port-tester.html[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no charging
threads.message:
Yes, the battery works on another board.

SCL/SDA - both 3.4v and 0.550

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no charging
threads.message:
What you get about battery into System Information window?

Check <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22, <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 and traces.
Just in case, change <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no charging
threads.message:
Charger connected but not charging battery.

I found that the system, shows charger connected, even disconnected. I restarted the system and it still shows charger connected!

I'm going to change the <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> and get the feedback.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no charging
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22, <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 - I already tested it, everything was perfect.

Before replacing the <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>, the board appears to charge the battery now, but when I unplug the charger, the system continues to recognize the charger (icon and lightning bolt). I changed the <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> and it continues! very crazy!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no charging
threads.message:
Check ACOK w/ and w/o charger connected.
Try changing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
